text: Marvin E. Pratt (born May 26, 1944) is an American politician. He was acting mayor of Milwaukee in 2004 and as interim Milwaukee County Executive in 2011. He was the first African-American to serve as mayor of Milwaukee. He ran for a full term as mayor but lost to Tom Barrett in the 2004 general election.Masse, Ryan. "Milwaukee mayor race reveals city's racial divide" , Badger Herald April 19, 2004; updated January 12, 2007 ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Mayors of Milwaukee Category:Politicians from Dallas Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:African- American politicians
title: Marvin Pratt
